Articles.Content:
> 
> anyway neither scott or chuck can beat a mlp ; )

The irony...

![irony.jpg](https://thisistwitchy.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/irony.jpg)

It's too much.
just some small little bit' or bite true true ; )

> 
> 3) it's easier to put a tomato into orbit.

I'll prove you wrong dammit.

> 
> Scott Manley did that too, then did it a second time, just to crosscheck his work.

And this was before Pi was even a concept, before people even realised circles were a thing.

Chuck Norris once looked Scott Manley in the eye.

Needless to say, he was scarred for life.

Even the Mighty Jeb and Valentina Kerman tremble when Scott walks nearby.

- - - Updated - - -

Scott Manley can spin vinyls on his turn tables so fast that they lift him up and away, opening a hole in spacetime.
Jebidiah has a father. His name is Manley.

> 
> 4) Why did Scott Manley cross the road?

To get more science...

> 
> To get more science...

(Also to test the oberth effect.)

There was something like this on Twitter once, but I can't seem to find all #ScottManleyFacts that I remember were tweeted.

Some I remember or found (those that I found now have the usernames of those that tweeted them):

Scott Manley can fully utilize the Oberth effect at apoapsis.

Scott Manley doesn't achieve orbital velocity. Orbital velocity achieves Scott Manley.

Scott Manley can soft land on Jool. (@ManleyFacts)

Scott Manley does not alter his trajectory, he repositions the universe. (@drxzcl)

Scott Manley raises his perikee above his apokee and gains velocity on the way up. (@drxzcl)

@matiasricarte: "[scott Manley] is the Chuck Norris of KSP" Ã¢â‚¬â€œ @ActsOfAndrewB: "Come on, when did you ever see Chuck Norris pull a space shuttle out of a flat spin?"

When Scott Manley DJs, he spins the cosmos, not tunes. (@felisconcolori)

Scott Manley doesn't exploit the oberth effect, the oberth effect exploits Scott Manley. (@NorwegianRJ)

Scott Manley is able to use time acceleration in real life. (@ActsofAndrewB)

Scott Manley can fly an engineless spaceplane to orbit by pumping fuel around. (@tnn2)

And, about Danny2462 rather than Scott Manley:

Danny2462 collided with Mun once. Mun crashed. (@TPJerematic)
Scott Manley has been scientifically proven to be the center of the universe, because he doesn't orbit an object, the object orbits him.
When Scott Manley was bored, he invented idiom "fifth wheel on a cart". Then he invented the wheel, so it could actually make some sense.
Scott Manley poked Voyager 1, and now it has escape velocity.
Scott Manley has been to Pluto. Twice.
Scott Manley knew what Ceres' bright spots are even before Dawn was sent there.

Scott Manley can land things using only his nose.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/c0W7S3fm_qI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
The Sputnik probe wasn't the first object in space. Scott Manley holds that particular title. :3
Humans haven't made it to interstellar space yet. Scott Manley has, though.
Scott Manley knows everything there is to know about kerbalkind. He knows even more than Harv.
Scott Manley is usually seen kicking children out of his house during Halloween while yelling; "YOUR LANDING VELOCITY IS INCORRECT!"

It has been mentioned earlier that Scott Manley has landed on Chuck Norris.

It has also been mentioned that Chuck Norris has been to Mars, which is why there is no life there.

What hasn't been mentioned is how Chuck Norris got to Mars: Scott Manley brought him there.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Chuck Norris once punched Scott Manley so hard one of his teeth flew into orbit, where it executed a flawless Hohmann transfer to Titan - upon arrival, it reacted with the organic compounds in its atmosphere and then returned to Earth, where it implanted itself in the ground and grew into Danny2462. Both Manley and Norris will deny this when questioned.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-10T20:55:11Z" title="06/10/2015 08:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 10, 2015</time> by parameciumkid**
Scott Manley is the rocketry tech support. His biggest client is NASA.

> 
> Scott Manley is the rocketry tech support. His biggest client is NASA.

The secret phone call that nobody back at NASA will admit to have on the records... 

"Hullo everyone, this is Scott Manley speaking. How can I help you? "

"Hi. This is Gene Krantz speaking, from Houston . We seem to have a problem with a mission to the Moon."

"What is the problem?"

"An oxygen tank at the Service Module is busted. Our boss have found shelter on the Lunar Module, but they need to dispose of carbon dioxide, and the scrubbers from the Sm don't fit. "

" Oh, that's a good one. Thing is, you'll have to jury rig it. First, you take the scrubbers..."
Scott Manley has an alter ego named Elon Musk.

The HULLO in Scott's latest video caused a man to go deaf.

Scott gave him back his hearing with Scott's god-like powers only minutes after he posted the video on youtube.

Manley is a more god-like word than... god.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-14T20:45:45Z" title="06/14/2015 08:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 14, 2015</time> by RAINCRAFTER**
